title: Strictly Come Dancing stars 'don't understand' voting on the show, claims Mike Bushell
text:
Strictly star Mike Bushell says the contestants do not understand how the show's voting process works in response to this week's surprise exit

Strictly Come Dancing contestants do not understand how the show’s voting process works, Mike Bushell has claimed.

He was responding to the surprise exit of Radio 1 DJ Dev Griffin, 34, and his professional partner Dianne Buswell, 30, who were voted off after Sunday’s dance-off.

Bushell, 53, said he was ‘amazed to still be in’ with his dance partner Katya Jones, 30, while Griffin – who he called ‘a much better dancer’ – was out.

But the BBC sports presenter told Radio Solent yesterday: ‘It’s a funny competition with the way the leaderboard and public vote works – no one really knows.

‘Sometimes it’s the couples right at the bottom who get saved, sometimes it’s those in the middle who are in jeopardy.’

Viewers have accused Strictly of fixing the result after Griffin and Miss Buswell were eliminated.

Radio 1 DJ Dev Griffin and professional dance partner Dianne Buswell were voted off with 27 after Sunday's dance-off

Some say the results were fixed as Dianne and Dev were unanimously voted off the show by all four judges - after facing dance-off against Viscountess Weymouth and Aljaz Skorjanec (pictured right)

Fans said they could not vote on Saturday to stop the couple going into Sunday night’s dance-off because of problems with the phone lines.

The pair were awarded a score of 27 out of 40 for their cha-cha-cha to Sam Smith’s Dancing With A Stranger.

This meant that they were forced to compete in a dance-off against Viscountess Emma Weymouth, 33, and her professional partner Aljaz Skorjanec, 29, before being unanimously voted off the show by all four judges.
description: Strictly Come Dancing star Mike Bushell says the contestants do not understand the voting process after Dev Griffin and Dianne Buswell's shock exit in the Sunday show (pictured).
authors: Hannah Dawson For The Daily Mail
